title: Thirupukazh (The Glory of the Divine)
author: Arunagirinathar
introduction: Thirupukazh, meaning 'Praise of the Lord,' is a masterpiece of devotional poetry in Tamil, consisting of hymns dedicated to Lord Murugan (Kartikeya). Composed by the saint-poet Arunagirinathar in the 15th century, the verses are renowned for their rhythmic complexity (Chandam) and profound spiritual content, focusing on the pursuit of spiritual liberation and the glory of Murugan's six abodes (Arupadaiveedu) and other sacred Sthalas (temples). The surviving collection contains approximately 1,307 songs.

chapters.name: Tirupparankundram (Part 1)
chapters.summary: Hymns 1 to 56 are dedicated to the holy mountain and temple of Tirupparankundram, the first of Murugan's six abodes. This is the site where Murugan married Deivanai (Devasena).

translations.english: O Lord, who bestows great grace!

chapters.name: Tirupparankundram (Part 2)
chapters.summary: This section continues the glorification of Lord Murugan at Tirupparankundram, focusing on his divine acts, his valor, and the saint's plea for liberation from the cycle of birth and death.

translations.english: You who live, raising the banner of victory in the sky and on the earth!
